section.heading: Exceptions.
section.text: *NOTE: This codification is not the most current, due to recent law changes. To see the current law (including emergency and temporary legislation, if relevant) click this link: Current Version*

para.text: The provisions of this chapter shall not apply:
To retail sales made via mail, phone, or internet;
To parking facilities that do not already accept cash as a form of payment as of December 1, 2020;

To a food store or retail establishment that provides a device on premises that converts cash, without charging a fee or requiring a minimum deposit amount greater than 5 dollars, into a prepaid card ("cash-to-card device") that allows a consumer to complete a transaction at the food store or retail establishment; provided, that:
Upon request, the cash-to-card device shall provide each consumer with a receipt indicating the amount of cash deposited onto the prepaid card;
The prepaid card shall not be subject to an expiration date and there shall be no limit on the number of transactions that may be completed on the card; and

In the event that the cash-to-card device malfunctions, the food store or retail establishment where the cash-to-card device is located shall accept, in accordance with this chapter, payment in cash from consumers during the time period in which the cash-to-card device does not function; or
During a period of time for which the Mayor has declared a public health emergency pursuant to [§ 7-2304.01].
